Description: Rim and body sherd of small Corinthian Silhouette Style pottery kotyle; interior glazed (fired brown); exterior: band of verticals between bands at rim; below, band in added red and wide black band above animal frieze in silhouette style (hind leg, rump and tail of four legged animal to right), with hailstone as filling ornament; inscription beneath rim.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219, no. 39)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 94, no. A130)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.237) (phase 3)
